Description: Tapestry square applied and sewn to an undyed linen, plain weave textile (open weave/no weft on the back of the square); the tapestry centre has a fragment of a bird with a beige, mauve, blue and green plummage on a red background framed by a beige plain band, and surrounded by a frame-on the top left and bottom right angles flowers with four petals, in beige, pink, yellow, green and blue, and in the top right and bottom left angles is a freize with columns and rows of lozenges, in red, pink, light green, light blue and blue; on a beige background; with an outer purple plain band around the square; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/23), weft-undyed linen (S/11); tapestry on single threads; warp-undyed wool (S/9), weft-beige, yellow, orange, pink, red, light green, green, light blue, blue, brown, mauve, purple wool (S/red is 44); antique, oversewing threads in undyed linen (S spun Z ply); on the tapestry are 3 lines of modern sewing in white cotton, running stitch, these were sewn to maintain the tapestry on the plain weave where it was damaged; the upper part of the tapestry is damaged and we can see the open weave in the back; all edges cut and ragged
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
